content.user_title: Create Next.js Components with Server/Client Patterns
content.value_statement: Building Next.js components with the wrong pattern leads to performance issues, hydration errors, and poor user experience. This skill provides patterns for server and client components, accessibility compliance, and React best practices to build efficient, accessible frontend components.
actual_capabilities: Distinguish when to use Server Components versus Client Components
Implement protected route patterns with authentication checks
Create accessible form handling with validation and error states
Apply Tailwind CSS patterns with conditional class utilities
Build accessibility patterns following WCAG 2.1 AA guidelines
Implement advanced patterns like drag-and-drop, undo/redo, and real-time polling
limitations: Does not provide working code files - only documentation and examples
Requires existing Next.js 16+ project setup to apply patterns
Does not install dependencies or configure build tools

best_practices: Default to Server Components for static content, SEO, and data fetching
Add 'use client' directive only when interactivity, hooks, or browser APIs are required
Always include accessibility attributes like aria-label, role, and keyboard navigation support
anti_patterns: Using 'use client' on every component just to be safe
Skipping accessibility attributes for simple components
Using inline styles instead of Tailwind utility classes

faq.question: When should I use Server Components vs Client Components?
faq.answer: Use Server Components by default for static content, layouts, and data fetching. Use Client Components only when interactivity, React hooks, browser APIs, or event handlers are needed.

faq.question: Does this skill work with Next.js 14 or 15?
faq.answer: Yes, patterns work with Next.js 14+ using App Router. Minor adjustments may be needed for version-specific features.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with JavaScript instead of TypeScript?
faq.answer: Yes, concepts apply to JavaScript. Remove type annotations and interface definitions for plain JS implementation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these patterns?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only provides documentation. No data is collected, transmitted, or stored by the skill itself.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing component libraries?
faq.answer: Patterns are library-agnostic. Apply server/client separation and accessibility patterns to components from Material UI, Chakra UI, or custom libraries.

faq.question: How is this skill different from official Next.js documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides practical implementation patterns, templates, and real-world examples from a project context, complementing official docs with ready-to-use code.
